resources.string:
Your aim is to control Tony the Tardigrade and help him forage enough food before he is forced into metabolic stasis for the next 30 years by scientists looking to investigate Tardigrade resilience.

You have 60 seconds to gather as much food as possible before the scientist put you to sleep, be aware of the Tardigrade’s natural predators that are hunting him as well.

Here is a list of predators and prey to look out for:
The Amoeba\nThis is a unicellular organism that has the ability to alter it’s shape by the extension and retraction of its pseudopods. These are natural the tardigrade’s natural predators.
The Nematode\nThis roundworm belonging to the family of parasitic worms known as helminths which inhabit a wide range of environments. These predators hunt the tardigrade at night.

Bioluminescent Algae\nThis algae known as Noctiluca, a small single celled animal (dinoflagellate) lives in many waters of the world. These only come out in the dark and are very nutritious to the tardigrade.
Bacteria\nThis salmonella bacteria from the family Enterobacteriaceae, is a single celled bacterium are numerous and although dangerous to humans, are a common source of food for the tardigrade.
Plant Cells\nTardigrades often feast on the cells of plants, the pierce the cell walls with its stylets and suck out the nutrients.
Thank you for playing, please enter your details below to submit your high score to the leaderboard
Please click the button below to take your photo for the leaderboard, if you do not wish to submit a photo we will assign you a default image

Hold the devide flat and move the player character by tilting the device. Collide with prey to score points and lose life if you collide with an enemy.\n\nHigher value prey appear if you play in the dark (or cover the device light sensor) but this brings out the more dangerous enemies. Going back into the light will bring back the weaker enemies and lower value prey.
Start with the phone in the flat position
To move down the screen, tilt the device towards you.
To move up the screen, tilt the device away from you.
To move left, tilt the device left.
To move right, tilt the device right.
